New Records: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 38 points, matching a career-high for the Grizzlies in the win.
The Grizzlies improved to 23-11 with the victory, maintaining their position in the Western Conference standings.
Key Match Events: John Konchar's three-point play with 1:05 left gave Memphis a 113-106 lead after the Suns had come within one point earlier.
Devin Booker returned to the court but struggled to contain Jaren Jackson Jr., who outscored the Suns 19-18 in a key moment late in the first quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns were without key players like Jusuf Nurkic and Bradley Beal, who left the game with injuries, putting extra pressure on Devin Booker to perform.
The Grizzlies were also missing Ja Morant and Zach Edey due to injuries, but managed to secure the win despite the absences.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns' sixth loss in seven games highlighted their struggles without Booker, who had been averaging 25.1 points and 6.4 assists per game before the injury.
The Grizzlies, despite missing two starters, showed resilience and depth, with Luke Kennard and Jaylen Wells contributing significantly to the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game saw 54 fouls and 58 free throws attempted, reflecting the physicality and intensity of the match.
The Suns' inability to contain Jaren Jackson Jr. in the paint was a key factor in the Grizzlies' victory.
Others: The game was a crucial test for both teams as they prepared for upcoming matches, with the Grizzlies set to face the Sacramento Kings next and the Suns looking to regroup after a tough stretch.
